benchmark_details.name: INJEC AGENT
benchmark_details.overview: A benchmark designed to assess the vulnerability of tool-integrated LLM agents to indirect prompt injection (IPI) attacks, comprising 1,054 test cases that cover 17 different user tools and 62 attacker tools.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and mitigate the risks associated with indirect prompt injection attacks on tool-integrated large language model agents.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark only focuses on specific user tools and attacker instructions, and does not cover all possible scenarios.

data.format: JSON-like structure including user instructions and tool response templates
data.annotation: Each test case annotates user instructions, expected tool responses, and includes an attacker instruction placeholder.

methods: Evaluation of LLM agents using structured test cases
methodology.calculation: ASR is calculated based on the proportion of successful attacks among valid outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ASR indicates greater vulnerability to IPI attacks.
methodology.validation: The evaluation of LLM agents includes valid output analysis to determine their resilience.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The benchmark exposes potential vulnerabilities but aims to strengthen security against them.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All data used for benchmarking is within ethical and legal bounds.
